DOC.brief_title: Oral Microdose Lupron Versus Luteal Estradiol Trial Poor Responder In Vitro Fertilization ( IVF ) Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Patients difficulty conceive naturally often seek medical advice . These patient often undergo initial treatment insemination use oral injectable medication . However , fails achieve pregnancy , patient often undergo vitro fertilization ( IVF ) . IVF process involve protocol injectable medication stimulate ovary produce several egg . These egg retrieve ultrasound guidance fertilize laboratory . After 3-5 day growth laboratory , appropriate number embryo transfer back patient 's uterus . Sometimes , patient go ovarian stimulation IVF respond well . These patient low estrogen level , egg retrieve , few embryo transfer back uterus . Overall , low pregnancy rate patient . It clear medication protocol would give high chance pregnancy . Two protocol , one call `` E2/antagonist '' protocol call `` OCP/microdose '' protocol , routinely use poor responder patient . But , never prospectively compare possible say whether one approach well . In order determine medication protocol result pregnancy , propose randomize poor responder patient schedule undergo treatment IVF one two protocol . These two protocol already standard care IVF center around world . Following randomization , clinical care study participant IVF patient . Specifically , adjustment medication , egg retrieval , embryo transfer procedures identical non-study patient undergo IVF . HYPOTHESIS We hypothesize poor responder patient undergo ovarian stimulation IVF E2/antagonist protocol high pregnancy rate OCP/microdose group .
DOC.criteria: Females couple indication IVF history poor response define one following : Cancellation IVF due inadequate follicular development Peak estradiol < 1000 pg/mL < 6 oocyte retrieve Age ≥18 year time signing informed consent Availability ejaculatory sperm ( use donate and/or cryopreserved sperm allow ) Willing able sign inform consent Prior use E2/ganirelix OCP/microdose protocol Less 2 ovary ovarian abnormality Presence uncorrected unilateral bilateral hydrosalpinx Presence clinically relevant pathology affect uterine cavity intramural fibroid ≥ 5cm Contraindications use gonadotropin ( e.g . tumor , pregnancy/lactation , undiagnosed vaginal bleeding , hypersensitivity , clinically significant ovarian cyst ) Contraindications use oral contraceptive pill ( h/o thromboembolism , breast cancer , undiagnosed vaginal bleeding ) Contraindications use estrogen patch ( h/o thromboembolism , breast cancer , undiagnosed vaginal bleeding ) Abnormal karyotyping patient partner ( karyotyping perform ) Hypersensitivity concomitant medication prescribe part treatment regimen protocol Transfer embryo patient plan ( i.e . gestational carrier use plan , embryo frozen ) Unable give inform consent
